newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil soybean plantings 43 pct complete - Safras.
newsitem.headline: Brazil soybean plantings 43 pct complete - Safras.

text.p: Brazilian soybean plantings were 43 percent complete by Nov 14 against 34 percent by Nov 16, 1995, and an average of the past five years of 36 percent, consultant Safras e Mercado said.
The pace of plantings has slowed a little given that 29 percent of the crop had been sowed by Nov 7 this year.
This was due to irregular weather which caused problems either of not enough moisture or too much rain in various areas. However the overall outlook remains favorable, Safras said.
Plantings of the 1996/97 crop by Nov 14 per state as estimated by Safras are as follows in percentage terms.

RIO GRANDE DO SUL - good progress in the past week despite some delays due to rains in producing regions November 10-13 PARANA - another week of much activity reflecting regular rains and adequate soil moisture. Planting almost finished in Cascavel and Maringa regions MATO GROSSO - planting going well with good soil moisture. A little more in the south would be better MATO GROSSO DO SUL - rains in the north and south of the state, with planting in the north delayed a little by the weather GOIAS - saw the most progress after soil moisture levels returned to normal the previous week.

SAO PAULO - rains at the beginning of the week were important to start again planting in the Sorocabana region. But the Mogiana area is still dry, delaying work slightly. MINAS GERAIS - planting was slowest in the Triangulo area because of irregular rains
